result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

wlagreen
walgreens
Initial Scheduling Order

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:01 AM Defendant Terry Lorenzo Weston in court in custody, by video with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Noah Johnson sworn in and testified. Witness identifes Defendant. Court takes judicial notice of 20CF633. State moves for bind over, Defense objects without argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Defense argues for modification of bond. Court denies bond modification.

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:06 PM Defendant Terry Lorenzo Weston in court, in person in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Ryan W O'Hara in person.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. State requests continuance due to Witness not being present. Court finds good cause to continue matter. Defense argues for modification of bond. State objects with argument. Court denies bond modification. Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.
A victim in this matter has requested to be notified of all proceedings.
Preliminary hearing on February 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
